block.p: Re ''For Black Athletes, Bracket Beats Out Batting Cages,'' March 20: There were blatant racial bars in Jackie Robinson's time, not only in baseball but in most aspects of American life. Freedom of choice simply did not exist for black athletes. Today, if young black Americans choose other athletic pursuits over baseball, so be it. I would rather see talented athletes of any race or nationality choose my favorite sport, baseball. But isn't freedom of choice what it's all about?
